weather_report:
As night blankets Downtown San Francisco, the air is thick with the promise of rain—a steady, enveloping presence that blurs the lines of the cityscape. With temperatures hovering around a cool 53 degrees, the South wind whistles and sways, stirring the senses and signaling the arrival of winter’s grip. Clouds gather like uninvited guests, cloaking the skyline in shades of gray, while the gusty winds hint at powerful gusts, caressing the foothills and brushing against your skin. Expect to witness the steadfast fall of rain, with a forecast that hands over the possibility of a quarter to an inch by dawn.

As the sun rises tomorrow, it will seem less an awakening and more a muted continuation of the night, for the rain will linger. The temperatures will take a downward turn, settling into the briskness of 52 degrees by afternoon. Visibility will remain shrouded, with any hint of the famous Golden Gate Bridge swallowed by low-hanging fog. Layers will be your best allies—consider a warm, water-resistant jacket paired with sturdy shoes to navigate the slick sidewalks. While adventure in the great outdoors may find you deterred, the cozy confines of a local café await. Think of losing yourself in a good book or engaging in quiet conversation, as the world outside dances with raindrops. This evening’s conversation flows as fluidly as the rain, offering moments of reflection amid the whispers of the wind.
